reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was expecting more from this Hotel as the Hilton in Ottawa is quite nice. It was very clean and confortable- excellents bedding- I only like duvets etc. But the whole overall feel was outdated, The pool area in basement very small and outdated. Gym looked nice with new machines. Quick drive to Downtown MTL as its right near the highway. Goos place to go with friends or alone but its not extremely romantic setting. Also the breakfast which I normally am in love with was a 2 on 10. Notworth it. Hardly any selection and the pancakes I ordered I had to send back. I think they were some sort of pita bread that they dipped in oil. They tasted almost oriental. The free parking was convinient and I had a great time at the Carrfour Laval mall which is about 2 minutes away. The nicest food court I have ever seen and food soo yummy.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.text: I had originally booked us at the Hilton Garden Inn near the airport, but when I realized that they charged extra (a lot extra) for parking in a lot, I switched our reservation to here. No extra parking charge.
reviews.title: Excellent choice near airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel doesn't look that great from the outside, but inside is very nice. We were upgraded to a jr suite at no extra charge. Lots of room and very nicely decorated. Very quiet.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: The executive lounge was closed for renovation, so they gave us tickets for the full buffet breakfast in the restaurant (very good bacon!) and for 2 appetizers and 2 soft drinks in the bar. You had to pay extra for alcohol. Appetizers we chose from a limited list were a vege and cheese platter that was quite large and a chicken quesadilla which was ok but nothing great--basically a tortilla filled with melted cheese, a couple of small pieces of chicken and tons of Pace mild picante sauce. But they were plenty for us.
reviews.title: Completly satisfied in every way with my stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it hadn't been so late when we arrived, we would have gone across the street to a strip mall where there were a couple of good looking restaurants.
reviews.title: Very good as a Montreal proxy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night in a standard, king room. It was quite a large room, nicely decorated, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The bath / shower was a bit dated but adequate. We had friendly service at the front desk. There is ample free parking and it's located within walking distance from a few restaurants and a very large shopping center (Carrefour Laval). There is also quite a "chic" bar and restaurant in the hotel but we didn't try them. We were annoyed at the extra fee for the wireless as well as the $6 bottle of water, let alone the mini-bar prices. Luckily we were there for only one night so it wasn't a big deal.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Overall, for the price that we paid, we were quite satisfied with this hotel compared to others in the area that we stayed at before.
reviews.title: A mixed bag for a Hilton

reviews.text: I stay in Hilton Hotels fairly frequently for works, so I am familiar with the Internet charges, the breakfast charges, etc.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in a very nice hotel

reviews.title: Good for a Quick Business Trip

reviews.text: Both my son and I took showers, Neither one of us had water pressure. It took about 30 min to get downtown.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad
Dont go there with a sport team!!!!
reviews.text: We were there from may 31st until june 3 2012. We booked for a hockey tournament with a team of 9 years old kid. We paid a total of 5300.00$ for our room. The hotel was very happy to take our money but once we were in our room, they started to ruin our stay. It started at 6:00 PM when we were sitting in they hallway next to our room when the manager came to tell everybody that we were not allowed to be outside our room!!!!! We were eating food very quietly. The next night, All the kids were sleeping at 08:00 PM and they send security to kick us from the allway. Both evening we asked for a room to have for the parents to get together but they had nothing to offer. We had to take sleeping kids from one room and put them in another room so the parents can get all together in that room. If you dont want to have kids in your hotel, just say no to team when they call to make a reservation instead of saying yes and after that threatening them with fine. Their gonna say that they make you sign a weaver but it dosn't say that you cannot sit down in the hallway in front of your room at 6:00 PM.

I have stayed at the Hilton Laval just off the Autoroute des Laurentides 3 times and consider it to be a good base of operations for business visits in the Montréal area. Its outside the city of Montréal, which some might consider a negative (and considering the traffic going into the city some days, this can be a factor, but just give yourself another half hour ; its a straight shot into Montréal), but when visiting people outside the city, in Laval of course but outside towards Mirabel, etc. it is very convenient. Even for going other points of the compass, as its so close to a major autoroute crossroads, you can go North, South, East or West in minutes.
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff, free parking

reviews.text: Not terribly expensive and free parking (not a given at Hiltons anymore...), the location also is convenient to restaurants and shopping ; Carrefour Laval is in walking distance across the highway. Sometimes abit tricky to figure out which exit to take for the hotel, once you get on to it, its not an issue.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay

reviews.text: My biggest gripe : as with all hotels of this category, let's get with the times and banish paid internet access, whether it be WiFi or wired ; its a scam that we should pay for it as it costs the hotel virtually nothing. Hotels of lesser category offer free WiFi ... why ? Because it attracts business and they can do it without affecting their bottom line. Why do hotels in this category charge for it ? Because they can, simple as that. And they figure if you shell out 130$CAN you can afford 10$ more... personally I think that's a crummy argument, but if we'd all protest then maybe things would change.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, highly recommend

reviews.text: All in all, I'll keep coming back to this hotel despite the charges for internet access, because in the greater scheme of things, its a minor point. I like this hotel, its location and the rooms are clean and large enough for me.
reviews.title: Just a sure thing - no issues here !
